summary: This is an email chain from August 2020 discussing the planning of a meeting between the Department of Justice and victims of Jeffrey Epstein. It involves coordination between FBI Victim Services personnel and a DOJ official regarding victim assistance in the Epstein investigation.

events.title: DOJ Victim Meeting Planning Call
events.description: A meeting scheduled from 3:30-4:30 p.m. to discuss the best way to proceed with a planned meeting between the Department of Justice and victims of Epstein.

keyFacts: The Department of Justice was in the early stages of planning a meeting with victims of Jeffrey Epstein as of August 2020.
FBI Victim Services Division personnel were coordinating with a DOJ Associate Deputy Attorney General regarding victim assistance for the Epstein investigation.
The email chain shows ongoing logistical coordination (scheduling calls) between law enforcement victim assistance officials.
The document references an 'Associate Deputy Attorney General and the Dal National Child Exploitation & Human Trafficking Coordinator' from DOJ, but the name is redacted.
The communication highlights the post-investigation victim support phase of the Epstein case.
